attributes.action: Bring back BBC Jam interactive learning service
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
What cost a fortune, children loved it and it was helping  to teach them what we wanted them to learn?

The BBC Jam Interactive learning service.

Paid for with BBC Licence Payers money, Its hard to believe its just been scrapped!

Children were already going through virtual worlds, speaking French with their friends and learning how the business world works.

At a time when there seems to be little investment for pupils with special education needs, BBC Jam was aimed at all ranges of ability and the entire 5 to 16 age group.

The project, which was approved by the Government and the European Commision, has cost £150m some of which was spent with independent production companies in the private sector.

However because some commercial companies with alternative products feel that their interests will be hurt, the decision has been taken to hurt the interests of our young people who enjoyed and were learning from BBC Jam, and to put the Interactive system that has already had huge investment and great success back in the box. 

We should neither waste this huge investment in the publics money nor our in childrens future!

BBC Jam must be reinstated!

rejection.details: This is a matter for the BBC Trust
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
